ElementDescription: Was study treatment discontinued for administrative reasons?
Notes: 1=Yes; 0=No;Note: This implies that both the patient and the clinical staff judge the assigned antipsychotic treatment to be a success (i.e. adequately effective, with tolerable or no side effects), and that treatment would have continued if not for the administrative reason independent of the study procedures.

ElementDescription:
Clinical diagnosis of Dementia of the Alzheimers Type (DSM-IV) or NINCDS/
ADRDA criteria for possible or probable Alzheimers disease (McKhann et al.,
1984).

Outpatient living at home, in residential care, or assisted living (not nursing
home).

Ambulatory, able to ambulate independently or with a cane or 4-point walker, but
not bed- or wheelchair- bound.

Presence of delusions, hallucinations, or agitation/aggression, severe enough to
disrupt the patients functioning, and severe enough, in the opinion of the
investigator, to justify medication treatment.

The delusions, hallucinations, or agitation/aggression have occurred nearly
everyday over the previous week, or at least intermittently over 4 weeks

A score of moderate or higher (score of ? 3) on any one of the following BPRS
items:

Onset of the psychotic or agitation/aggression must have been after the onset of
cognitive and functional signs or symptoms of dementia.

Must have an informant who lives with, or visits the patient at least 8 hours per
week over at least 3-4 days per week.

Informed consent from patient and legal representative, or assent from the
patient and informed consent from the representative according to relevant state
laws

The results of laboratory screening studies (see below) are not inconsistent with
a psychosis of Alzheimers disease or agitation not due to a medical cause.
Receiving and benefiting from psychotropic medication treatment

Fulfills criteria for schizophrenia, schizoaffective disorder, delusional disorder,
or mood disorder with psychotic features

Has a psychosis, agitation, or aggression that could be better accounted for by
another general medical condition or direct physiological effects of a substance
Fulfills criteria for probable vascular dementia (AIRENS-NINDS criteria)
Fulfills criteria for Lewy body variant of AD (McKeith criteria)
Severe or unstable medical illness treatment
In need of psychiatric admission in judgment of study site or local physicians
Acutely suicidal or has persistent suicidal intent

Previous or current treatment with any two of the three atypical antipsychotic
study medications or with citalopram
Current use of antidepressants or anticonvulsants

Current plans to start a cholinesterase inhibitor or antidepressant medication
during the subsequent 24 weeks ( patient may be currently receiving stable
doses of a cholinesterase inhibitor)
Hypersensitivity or absolute contraindications to any of the study medications

ElementDescription: Primary reason for the participant's protocol violation/deviation
ValueRange: Early discont.; LLA; LVT; Non-Adherent; Rand. Err; Visit window; Sub Lack effic; Sub Side eff; Clin Lack effic; Clin Side eff; Treat site; Unwill proc; Unable cont; Interv ill; Other
Notes: Early discont.=Early treatment discontinuation; LLA=Start/stop/change LLA; LVT=Start/stop/change LVT ; Non-Adherent=Was not at least 50% adherent with taking study meds over the 5 months of follow-up (V7 ? V11) AND at least 50% adherent with taking study medsover the last month of the study (V11) ; Rand. Err=Randomization error ; Visit window=Outside visit window; Sub Lack effic=Subject's decision: Lack of efficacy of study medication; Sub Side eff=Subject's decision: Side effects of study medication; Clin Lack effic=Clinician's decision: Lack of efficacy of study medication; Clin Side eff=Clinician's decision: Side effects of study medication; Treat site=No longer wants to be treated at study site (or seeking treatment elsewhere); Unwill proc=Unwilling/unable to comply with study procedures; Unable cont=Unable to be contacted/schedule a follow-up; Interv ill=Intervening medical illness that precludes continued participaation in the study

ElementDescription: Last study visit number the subject was still on protocol

Notes:
The FSEQNO variable in the ADJ form has a special interpretation compared to other forms.
For example, ADJ FSEQNO of '1' can be thought of as being '001', FSEQNO of '2' can be thought of as
being '002', and FSEQNO of '3' can be thought of as being '003'.
The first digit of FSEQNO relates to the corresponding ENF sequence number at that visit and the third
digit relates to the specific adjudicator who completed the adjudication form.
